definitions.definition: Senses relating to expressing sounds , etc., or disclosing something

subdefinitions.definition: Sometimes preceded by forth , out , etc. : to produce (a cry , speech , or other sounds) with the voice . To verbally express or report (a desire or emotion , an idea or thought , etc.). ( reflexive ) To express (oneself) in speech or writing . ( figurative ) Of a thing : to produce (a noise or sound); to emit . ( obsolete ) To disclose or reveal (something secret or unknown ); to bring to light . ( obsolete , also reflexive ) To disclose or reveal the identity or nature of (oneself or someone, or something). ( obsolete , also reflexive ) To display or show (itself or something).
examples: Sally’s car uttered a hideous shriek when she applied the brakes.

subdefinitions.definition: To speak . Of words , etc.: to be spoken.

To publish (something). ( law ) To put ( currency or other valuable items ) into circulation ; specifically, to pass off ( counterfeit currency, etc.) as legal tender ; to use (a forged cheque ) as if genuine . ( figurative ) To pass off (something fake ) as a genuine item. ( obsolete ) To supply (something); to furnish , to provide . ( obsolete ) To offer (something, such as goods ) for barter or sale ; also, to sell (something); to vend . ( obsolete , rare ) To announce that (something) is available for sale; to cry. ( obsolete , rare ) To distribute or issue (something) from, or as if from, a stock of items. ( obsolete except UK , dialectal ) To discharge or send out (something); to eject , to emit.
Of goods: to be purchased ; to sell.
examples: This crockery is popular and utters well.

main_definition: Senses relating to expressing sounds , etc., or disclosing something
